MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Mastery of required technologies and ability to apply them effectively.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess depth and breadth of knowledge in C#, .NET, SQL, SSRS, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and other relevant technologies. Evaluate practical experience through work samples, coding challenges, and discussion of past projects. Verify certifications where applicable.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding or practical experience with core technologies. Requires significant guidance and training.
Adequate understanding and some practical experience. Can perform basic tasks with supervision.
Strong understanding and practical experience. Can independently develop and implement solutions. Demonstrates problem-solving skills.

Expert level knowledge and extensive practical experience. Can lead technical initiatives, mentor others, and develop innovative solutions. Deep understanding of system architecture and best practices.

MainCategory.Description: Problem Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present candidates with technical challenges and case studies. Assess their ability to break down problems, analyze requirements, and propose solutions. Evaluate their understanding of debugging techniques and testing methodologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze complex problems and identify root causes. Requires significant guidance to develop solutions.
Can analyze basic problems and identify obvious root causes. Develops solutions with some guidance.
Independently analyzes complex problems, identifies root causes, and develops effective solutions. Demonstrates strong debugging and testing skills.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. Can anticipate potential problems, develop innovative solutions, and optimize system performance.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration: Ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences and collaborate effectively with team members.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess communication skills through interviews and presentations. Evaluate collaboration skills through team-based exercises and discussions of past projects. Seek feedback from previous colleagues and supervisors.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to communicate technical information clearly and effectively. Difficulty collaborating with team members.
Communicates technical information adequately. Collaborates with team members with some guidance.
Communicates technical information clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborates effectively with team members.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, build consensus, and lead collaborative efforts.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Expertise: Knowledge and experience in all phases of the SDLC.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about experience with requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance. Assess understanding of different SDLC methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall). Evaluate ability to create technical documentation and test plans.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited knowledge and experience with the SDLC. Requires significant guidance in all phases.
Basic knowledge and experience with the SDLC. Can participate in some phases with supervision.
Strong knowledge and experience in all phases of the SDLC. Can independently manage projects and contribute to process improvements.
Expert knowledge and extensive experience in all phases of the SDLC. Can lead SDLC initiatives, mentor others, and develop best practices.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability and Learning Agility: Demonstrates the ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing priorities and requirements.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's track record of learning new technologies and adapting to new environments. Use behavioral questions to understand how they approach unfamiliar situations. Evaluate their willingness to embrace new tools and methodologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to change and struggles to learn new technologies quickly. Prefers to stick with familiar tools and approaches.
Open to learning new technologies but requires significant time and effort to become proficient. Adapts to change with some difficulty.
Quickly learns new technologies and adapts to changing priorities and requirements. Embraces new tools and methodologies and actively seeks opportunities for professional development.
Excels at learning new technologies and adapting to dynamic environments. Proactively identifies opportunities to improve processes and technologies and mentors others in adopting new approaches.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Review: Ability to write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code. Actively participates in code reviews.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples for clarity, efficiency, and adherence to coding standards. Assess understanding of code review best practices. Evaluate ability to provide constructive feedback to peers.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is difficult to understand and maintain. Does not actively participate in code reviews.
Code is generally understandable and maintainable. Participates in code reviews and provides some feedback.
Code is clean, well-documented, and maintainable. Actively participates in code reviews and provides constructive feedback.

SubCategory.Description: Testing and Debugging: Ability to write unit tests, perform integration testing, and debug complex systems.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess understanding of different testing methodologies. Evaluate ability to write effective unit tests and integration tests. Present candidates with debugging scenarios and assess their problem-solving skills.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of testing and debugging techniques. Struggles to write unit tests and debug complex systems.
Basic understanding of testing and debugging techniques. Can write basic unit tests and debug simple systems.
Strong understanding of testing and debugging techniques. Can write effective unit tests and debug complex systems independently.

SubCategory.Description: System Configuration and Maintenance: Experience in maintaining and modifying system configurations.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess experience with configuration management tools and processes. Evaluate ability to troubleshoot system issues and implement effective solutions. Inquire about experience with scripting and automation.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with system configuration and maintenance. Requires significant guidance to perform basic tasks.
Basic experience with system configuration and maintenance. Can perform basic tasks with supervision.
Strong experience with system configuration and maintenance. Can independently troubleshoot system issues and implement effective solutions.

SubCategory.Description: Customer Focus: Commitment to providing excellent customer service and meeting customer needs.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess customer service skills through behavioral questions and scenario-based exercises. Evaluate ability to understand customer needs and translate them into technical solutions. Seek feedback from previous customers or stakeholders.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited focus on customer needs. Struggles to understand and address customer concerns.
Adequate focus on customer needs. Can understand and address basic customer concerns with some guidance.
Strong focus on customer needs. Can effectively understand and address customer concerns and translate them into technical solutions.

SubCategory.Description: Time Management and Prioritization: Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess time management skills through behavioral questions and discussions of past projects. Evaluate ability to prioritize tasks and manage competing demands. Seek feedback from previous supervisors or colleagues.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor time management skills. Struggles to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Adequate time management skills. Can prioritize tasks and meet deadlines with some guidance.
Strong time management skills. Can effectively prioritize tasks and meet deadlines independently.
